intro: Astracantha lagowskii, commonly known as the African milkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant produces a milky sap that is toxic and can cause skin irritation. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Astracantha lagowskii is valued for its ornamental appeal and has some traditional uses in local medicine.
